page.title: 10THE WILLOWS,RYTON,GATESHEAD.
page.content: Towards{Wylam}we pass the boat club and further along we pass the golf course. There is a cinder track running along the side of the river. People use the Willows for walking, playing, camping, fishing, picnicking, boating and water skiing. There are plans being made now for the local government to purchase all land not already owned by them leading down to the Willows and towards {Newburn Bridge.}The idea is that the Willows will be opened up as a recreation centre with nature trails and fishing and boating facilities. Access will be available from Newburn Bridge where there will be a car park area. There is talk of allowing sheep to graze on the land but there have been many objections by dog owners who use the Willows to exercise their dogs.
